Class DynamicVoltageRegulator

java.lang.Object
SystemEnvironment.DynamicVoltageRegulator
public class DynamicVoltageRegulator extends Object
Dynamic Voltage Regulator facade that coordinates DVFS-related events.

This component owns a DynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod implementation and delegates all DVFS decisions and actions to it. The regulator is notified of system events (job arrival, first execution, lock/unlock, completion, deadline miss, blocking, core(s) executing, end of system time) and forwards them to the underlying method together with the contextual objects (Processor, Core, Job, SharedResource). The previous inline comments indicated where debug prints used to be; those calls are now captured in this documentation as the event flow.

The regulator also records the DVFS scope via Definition.DVFSType (e.g., full-chip, per-core, VFI) and keeps a reference to its parent Processor for method callbacks.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DynamicVoltageRegulator()
    Constructs a regulator with no DVFS method, no parent processor and no DVFS type.

    Notifies that a job is blocked by a shared resource, which may trigger DVFS changes (e.g., reduce speed while waiting).

    Notifies that a specific core is executing, allowing per-core DVFS checks/adjustments.

    Notifies that cores are executing so the DVFS method can perform periodic/global checks across all cores (e.g., reevaluate speeds).

    Notifies at the end of the system time horizon so the DVFS method can perform end-of-simulation or end-of-interval actions.

    Notifies that a job has completed; the DVFS method can finalize any per-job accounting and possibly adjust speeds.

  • Constructor Details

    • DynamicVoltageRegulator

      public DynamicVoltageRegulator()
      Constructs a regulator with no DVFS method, no parent processor and no DVFS type. These must be set via the corresponding setters before use.

  • Method Details

    • definedSpeed

      public void definedSpeed()
      Initializes or updates available speeds by delegating to the configured DynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod with the current parent Processor. This is typically called once the processor model and core sets are constructed.

    • checkJobArrivesProcessor

      public void checkJobArrivesProcessor(Job j, Processor p)
      Notifies the regulator that a job arrived at the processor level, so the DVFS method can react (e.g., global scaling or queue-aware policies).
      Parameters:
      j - the arriving Job
      p - the Processor to which the job arrives

    • checkJobArrivesCore

      public void checkJobArrivesCore(Job j, Core c)
      Notifies the regulator that a job arrived at a specific core, enabling per-core or local DVFS reactions when applicable.
      Parameters:
      j - the arriving Job
      c - the Core where the job arrives

    • checkCoresExecute

      public void checkCoresExecute()
      Notifies that cores are executing so the DVFS method can perform periodic/global checks across all cores (e.g., reevaluate speeds).

    • checkCoreExecute

      public void checkCoreExecute(Core c)
      Notifies that a specific core is executing, allowing per-core DVFS checks/adjustments.
      Parameters:
      c - the Core that is currently executing

    • JobFirstExecuteAction

      public void JobFirstExecuteAction(Job j)
      Notifies that the given job is about to execute for the first time, so the DVFS method can perform any first-execution actions (e.g., speed boost or logging).
      Parameters:
      j - the Job beginning its first execution

    • checkJobEveryExecute

      public void checkJobEveryExecute(Job j)
      Notifies for every execution step of a job, enabling continuous DVFS monitoring and adjustments.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job currently executing

    • checkJobLock

      public void checkJobLock(Job j, SharedResource r)
      Notifies that a job attempted to lock a shared resource, allowing the DVFS method to react to blocking/locking behavior if needed.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job that locks or attempts to lock the resource
      r - the SharedResource being locked

    • checkJobUnlock

      public void checkJobUnlock(Job j, SharedResource r)
      Notifies that a job has unlocked a shared resource, which may influence DVFS decisions (e.g., contention is relieved).
      Parameters:
      j - the Job unlocking the resource
      r - the SharedResource that was unlocked

    • checkJobComplete

      public void checkJobComplete(Job j)
      Notifies that a job has completed; the DVFS method can finalize any per-job accounting and possibly adjust speeds.
      Parameters:
      j - the completed Job

    • checkEndSystemTimeAction

      public void checkEndSystemTimeAction(long systemTime)
      Notifies at the end of the system time horizon so the DVFS method can perform end-of-simulation or end-of-interval actions.
      Parameters:
      systemTime - the system time (ticks) at which to perform final checks

    • checkJobMissDeadline

      public void checkJobMissDeadline(Job j)
      Notifies that a job has missed its deadline, enabling the DVFS method to react for logging or remedial speed policies.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job that missed its deadline

    • checkBlockAction

      public void checkBlockAction(Job blockedJob, SharedResource blockingRes)
      Notifies that a job is blocked by a shared resource, which may trigger DVFS changes (e.g., reduce speed while waiting).
      Parameters:
      blockedJob - the Job that is currently blocked
      blockingRes - the SharedResource causing the block

    • setDynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod

      public void setDynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod(DynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod m)
      Installs the concrete DVFS method implementation and sets the back reference from the method to this regulator.
      Parameters:
      m - the DynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod to use

    • setParentProcessor

      public void setParentProcessor(Processor p)
      Sets the parent processor reference used by the DVFS method when making system-wide decisions.
      Parameters:
      p - the parent Processor

    • setDVFSType

      public void setDVFSType(String s)
      Sets the DVFS scope/type from a string value.

      Accepted values (case-sensitive as used in the original code):

      • "full-chip" → Definition.DVFSType.FullChip
      • "per-core" → Definition.DVFSType.PerCore
      • "VFI" → Definition.DVFSType.VFI
      Values outside this set are ignored (type remains unchanged).
      Parameters:
      s - the DVFS type as a string label

    • getDynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod

      public DynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod getDynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod()
      Returns the currently installed DVFS method implementation.
      Returns:
      the DynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod in use, or null if none has been set

    • getParentProcessor

      public Processor getParentProcessor()
      Returns the parent processor used by the DVFS method.
      Returns:
      the parent Processor, or null if unset

    • getDVFSType

      public Definition.DVFSType getDVFSType()
      Returns the DVFS scope/type recorded by this regulator.
      Returns:
      the Definition.DVFSType (may be null if not yet set)
